name: Heldric - The legend of the shoemaker
description: Heldric is a unique blend of hack-n-slash and tower defense rolled into one. Build and upgrade structures to defend against waves of monsters intent on killing everyone. Fight goblins, orcs, spiders, trolls and more. Do you have what it takes to survive?

reviews.review_text: So far this has been worth the price, it's not AAA quality, but it is better than I expected. Better than a number of other games in this price bracket. I haven't hit any bugs yet, although I understand others have. The non epic player character approach and no requirement to grind for days to get something worthwhile is a nice change. That said, it is a casual game, definently not trying to be a Diablo clone.

Build your village, place your traps, and protect the people! ... all while upgrading your village, your traps, and spawning more people! Tons of fun and there's a really tough challenge mode that will keep you busy. Wishlist it at least so you don't forget about it and grab it on sale one day :)

Well its a good concept, but the idea kinda falls flat with this game. not enought content for the price... and its only $10! I usually rate games based on how much i play them, even after winning 'the game'. so 100 hours in a $40 game is a good buy for me. this game just lacks the content to keep me entertained even for $10. there is 'challange' mode.. but why? it doesn't even work how I wished it would, there is no 'endless' mode, witch there is a BUTTON for it after you win every map, but you can't do it!? but I dont really even see a point in that, most games i have build everything there is to build by the end of the map and i'm just mashing 'next wave' due to boredom killing wild life. I want more buildings, higher level upgrades, bigger waves, catastrophic death!  its fun for what it is, just need about another year of development before 'fun'.
